response.job_title: Sr. Cloud Infra. Architect at Amazon Web Services (AWS)
response.summary: An electronic engineer with a wide knowledge of information technology and specialized in infrastructure deployment. Hands-on experience for more than 7 years implementing core DevOps concepts such as containerization, virtualization, version control, cloud computing, database management, and Unix Operating Systems. I'm continuously looking for new challenges in cloud computing to make everyone’s life easier.
response.skills: Security Controls, Teamwork, Migration Projects, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Programming, Virtualization, System Administration, Technical Support, Cloud Computing, Configuration Management, Linux, IBM AIX, Unix, Matlab, C++, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, VMware, Docker Products, PHP

profile_positions.description:
Provide services to clients on hardware and software components specially for UNIX Systems. 

Implementation and Administration of OS:
-PowerVM and PowerKVM on Power Systems: Planning - implementation, administration - customization, problem determination - solution, performance tunning, SAN management and OS Upgrades/Updates (AIX - IBM i - RHEL - SLES - HMC - LPARs -DLPAR - LPM - DPO - VIOS - Dual SEAs - VSCSI - NPV - VSWITCH - VIOS Shared Storage Pool - GPFS - PowerHA - NIM Server - Power VC).
-VMware, KVM on Intel X86: Support, administration and troubleshooting, con-
figuration, updates / upgrades, scripting, networking, monitoring / system logs on Unix / Linux (Suse - Red hat) on Intel processors x86.

Networking and Storage:
Basic knowledge for implementing and administrating Cisco switches, Fiber
Channel - Brocades and Storwize Storage Family.

Software:
IBM Power Systems, PowerVM, KVM, VMWare, Unix/Linux, Matlab, Microsoft Office, Orcad, KiCad, Vim, Wireshark, AWS, GCP.

Programming:
Bash, C++, Java, Verilog, LATEX.

company.name: Amazon Web Services (AWS)
company.description:
Launched in 2006, Amazon Web Services (AWS) began exposing key infrastructure services to businesses in the form of web services -- now widely known as cloud computing. The ultimate benefit of cloud computing, and AWS, is the ability to leverage a new business model and turn capital infrastructure expenses into variable costs. Businesses no longer need to plan and procure servers and other IT resources weeks or months in advance. Using AWS, businesses can take advantage of Amazon's expertise and economies of scale to access resources when their business needs them, delivering results faster and at a lower cost.

Today, Amazon Web Services provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. With data center locations in the U.S., Europe, Singapore, and Japan, customers across all industries are taking advantage of our low cost, elastic, open and flexible, secure platform.
